result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward J Safforld Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Imran Kurter appeared by video for Edward J Safforld Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 11-8-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward J Safforld Jr in court.  Attorney Imran Kurter in court for Edward J Safforld Jr.  Attorney Michael Odden in court for State of Wisconsin.  Discovery and offer needed.  Defense requests additional time. Case adjourned in Branch 10.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rachelle L.C.

Defendant Edward James Safforld in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Edward James Safforld in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward James Safforld appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
